thread.title: Rollins, Richards featured guests at jazz foundation benefit
thread.title_full: Rollins, Richards featured guests at jazz foundation benefit

author: senh
title: Rollins, Richards featured guests at jazz foundation benefit
text:
Daily Oklahoman , Thursday - 10/22/2015 - 05:26 PM 
By Brandy McDonnell BAM Features WriterThe “Storyteller” Carrie Underwood and the “Reloaded” Blake Shelton are headed for the top of the country album charts. The Oklahoma natives are releasing their newest projects — Underwood's long-awaited fifth studio album “Storyteller” and Shelton's second greatest-hits collection “Reloaded: 20 #1 Hits” — on Friday. Despite their divergent personalities and musical styles, Underwood, who hails from Checotah, and Shelton, an Ada native who lives in Tishomingo, are among the rare sure bets on the ever-shifting mainstream country music scene. Despite the dominance of the bro-country guys on the charts, Underwood remains a chart-topping force to be reckoned with: The seven-time Grammy winner set a record over the summer when she released her new album's first single, “Smoke Break,” a relatable tribute to overworked small-town moms and overstressed big-city businessmen desperate for respite. “Smoke Break” burned its way to the highest one-week add total in the history of the trade publication Country Aircheck, scoring 145 Mediabase adds and 159 total Billboard and Country Aircheck reporting stations on board for the song's official airplay impact date.
